entry.title: Workshops and Activation for CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY and CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
entry.summary:
In an initiative to further the development and review process of soft fork proposals for Bitcoin, a request was made on IRC channel ctv-csfs-activation on libera.chat for economic nodes to provide their feedback by 5 March 2025. This move aimed at enhancing the involvement of core contributors in the decision-making process, as evidenced by a letter signed by Bitcoin developers on 9 June 2025. The discussion points include various technical aspects such as the preference of CHECKSIGFROMSTACK over TEMPLATEHASH, which is limited to taproot, and debates around the utility of CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY. The discord among developers regarding these specifics highlights the complexity and diversity of opinions within the community.
Furthermore, the establishment of an IRC channel dedicated to workshops, meetings, and activation discussions signifies a structured approach to reaching consensus on the covenants activation on Bitcoin. This initiative reflects a shift towards more organized and collaborative efforts among developers and stakeholders in the Bitcoin ecosystem. The mention of BIP 8 as a potentially better option for the next soft fork indicates ongoing evaluations of strategies to improve Bitcoin's protocol securely and efficiently.
The dialogue also touches upon the changing landscape of Bitcoin node usage, with approximately 15% of nodes now using knots, signaling a significant shift from previous patterns. This statistic underscores the dynamic nature of Bitcoin's infrastructure and the importance of accommodating diverse technological preferences within the community.
Relevant links provided in the communication, such as [gnusha.org](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAFvNmHS4s_MbXP8o3kWmaUZ5Xks1b76jSDymp1Bjr--4R8_v3Q@mail.gmail.com/) and [diyhpl.us](https://diyhpl.us/cgit/pi-bitcoindev/plain/cc/877bbc8de83e7aa4d2252a0473d05d634946b4/dev/fd0), offer additional resources for those interested in the technical details and developments within the Bitcoin development community. These efforts to foster open discussion and collaboration among Bitcoin developers highlight the ongoing commitment to ensuring the cryptocurrency's robustness and adaptability to meet future demands.
